cards.name: Arrogant Vampire
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Charm and grace may hide a foul heart.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Assassin's Blade
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target nonblack attacking creature.
cards.original_text:
Play Assassin's Blade only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Destroy any one attacking creature that isn't black.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Bog Raiders
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.
cards.original_text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Bog Raiders can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.
cards.original_text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Bog Wraith can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Charging Bandits
cards.text: Whenever Charging Bandits attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The fear in their victims' eyes is their most cherished reward.
cards.original_text: If Charging Bandits attacks, it gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Craven Knight
cards.text: Craven Knight can't block.
cards.flavor: "I say victory is better than honor."
cards.original_text: Craven Knight can't intercept.

cards.name: Cruel Bargain
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
cards.original_text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up. (For example, if you have 11 life, you lose 6 life.)

cards.name: Cruel Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: The more you pay for the lesson, the better you'll remember it.
cards.original_text: Search your deck for any card. Shuffle your deck and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Dread Charge
cards.text: Black creatures you control can't be blocked this turn except by black creatures.
cards.flavor: "As equal were their souls, so equal was their fate." —John Dryden, "Ode to Mrs. Anne Killigrew"
cards.original_text: This turn, your black creatures can be intercepted only by other black creatures.

cards.name: Dread Reaper
cards.text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper comes into play from your hand, you lose 5 life. (The person who plays Dread Reaper loses the life.)

cards.name: Dry Spell
cards.text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: A fist of dust to line your throat, a bowl of sand to fill your belly.
cards.original_text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)

cards.name: Ebon Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon comes into play from your hand, you may force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Endless Cockroaches
cards.text: When Endless Cockroaches dies, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text: If Endless Cockroaches is put into your discard pile from play, return Endless Cockroaches to your hand.

cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Final Strike
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Final Strike deals damage to target opponent or planeswalker equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
cards.original_text: Choose one of your creatures. Final Strike deals to your opponent damage equal to that creature's offense. Then, put the creature in your discard pile.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.original_text: When Gravedigger comes into play from your hand, you may choose to return a summon creature from your discard pile to your hand.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: Death claims all but the darkest souls.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one creature that isn't black. (A creature is black if it has {B} in its cost.)

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: Death claims all but the darkest souls.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one creature that isn't black.

cards.name: Howling Fury
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.
cards.original_text: Any one creature gets +4/+0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: King's Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor: Fear is as effective a weapon as the blade.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap King's Assassin to destroy any one tapped creature.

cards.name: Mercenary Knight
cards.text: When Mercenary Knight enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
cards.original_text: When Mercenary Knight comes into play from your hand, choose and discard a summon creature from your hand or destroy Mercenary Knight.

cards.name: Mind Knives
cards.text: Target opponent discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: To dodge the unerring knife, one must be free of thought.
cards.original_text: Your opponent discards a card at random from his or her hand.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.original_text: Your opponent chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)

cards.name: Muck Rats
cards.flavor: The difference between a nuisance and a threat is often merely a matter of numbers.

cards.name: Nature's Ruin
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures.
cards.flavor: One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.
cards.original_text: Destroy all green creatures. (This includes your green creatures.)

cards.name: Noxious Toad
cards.text: When Noxious Toad dies, each opponent discards a card.
cards.original_text: If Noxious Toad is put into your discard pile from play, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Python
cards.flavor: What could it have swallowed to grow so large?

cards.name: Rain of Tears
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: When emotions rain down, what rivers will be born?
cards.original_text: Destroy any one land.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
cards.original_text: Return any one summon creature from your discard pile to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.name: Serpent Assassin
cards.text: When Serpent Assassin enters the battlefield, you may destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.original_text: When Serpent Assassin comes into play from your hand, you may choose to destroy any one creature that isn't black.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.original_text: When Serpent Warrior comes into play from your hand, you lose 3 life. (The person who plays Serpent Warrior loses the life.)

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.name: Skeletal Crocodile
cards.flavor: The less flesh there is, the more teeth there seem to be.

cards.name: Skeletal Snake
cards.flavor: They watched as the snake shed layer after layer until only cold bone remained.

cards.name: Soul Shred
cards.text: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: It would be a shame to let life slip away to nothing.
cards.original_text: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Undying Beast
cards.text: When Undying Beast dies, put it on top of its owner's library.
cards.original_text: If Undying Beast is put into your discard pile from play, put Undying Beast on top of your deck.

cards.name: Vampiric Feast
cards.text: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to any target and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: It's not always gold the thief is after.
cards.original_text: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to any one creature or player. You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Vampiric Touch
cards.text: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to target opponent or planeswalker and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: A touch, not comforting, but of death.
cards.original_text: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to your opponent. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Virtue's Ruin
cards.text: Destroy all white creatures.
cards.flavor: All must fall, and those who stand highest fall hardest.
cards.original_text: Destroy all white creatures. (This includes your white creatures.)

cards.name: Wicked Pact
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
cards.original_text: Destroy any two creatures that aren't black. You lose 5 life. (You can't play Wicked Pact unless you can choose two creatures to destroy.)

cards.name: Ancestral Memories
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.original_text: Look at the top seven cards of your deck. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your discard pile.

rulings.text: If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
This is not considered a draw or a discard.

cards.name: Balance of Power
cards.text: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
cards.original_text: If you have fewer cards in your hand than your opponent does, draw until you have the same number. (When you play Balance of Power, it doesn't count as in your hand.)

rulings.text: The number of cards is counted during resolution.

cards.name: Baleful Stare
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
cards.original_text: Look at your opponent's hand. For each mountain and red card there, you draw a card. (You draw from your deck.)

cards.name: Capricious Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Capricious Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Capricious Sorcerer to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Cloak of Feathers
cards.text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: A thousand feathers from a thousand birds, sewn with magic and song.
cards.original_text: Any one creature gains flying until the end of the turn. You draw a card.

cards.name: Cloud Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can block only creatures with flying.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can intercept only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloud Pirates
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Pirates can block only creatures with flying.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Cloud Pirates can intercept only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloud Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can intercept only creatures with flying.

rulings.text: If it loses Flying, it will be unable to block any creatures.

cards.name: Command of Unsummoning
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return one or two target attacking creatures to their owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Play Command of Unsummoning only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Return any one or two attacking creatures to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Coral Eel
cards.flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

cards.name: Cruel Fate
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library. Put one of those cards into that player's graveyard and the rest on top of their library in any order.
cards.original_text: Look at the top five cards of your opponent's deck. Put one of them into your opponent's discard pile and the rest on top of his or her deck in any order.

cards.name: Deep-Sea Serpent
cards.text: Deep-Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: Sailors fear the deep-sea serpent; others thank the gods it has no legs.
cards.original_text: Deep-Sea Serpent can attack only if the defending player has an island in play.

cards.name: Déjà Vu
cards.text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The past is a mirror of the future.
cards.original_text: Return any one sorcery card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Djinn of the Lamp
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Once they learn the trick of carrying their own lamps, they never touch the ground again.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping his or her creatures and lands.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.name: Flux
cards.text:
Each player discards any number of cards, then draws that many cards.
Draw a card.
cards.original_text: Each player chooses and discards from his or her hand any number of cards and then draws that many cards. You then draw a card. (You choose first.)

rulings.text: The discard is forced even though you choose how many to discard.
Each player chooses how many cards they would like to discard. That number may be 0.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavor: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

cards.name: Horned Turtle
cards.flavor: Its spear has no shaft, its shield no handle.

cards.name: Ingenious Thief
cards.text:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief comes into play from your hand, look at your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text: When Man-o'-War comes into play from your hand, return any one creature to its owner's hand. (If you're the only one with creatures, return one of them to your hand.)

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

cards.name: Mystic Denial
cards.text: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.
cards.original_text: Play Mystic Denial only in response to another player playing a summon creature or a sorcery. That card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her discard pile.

cards.name: Omen
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.
cards.original_text: Look at the top three cards of your deck and return them in any order. You may choose to shuffle your deck. Then draw a card.

cards.name: Owl Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar comes into play from your hand, draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Personal Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.original_text: Search your deck for a sorcery and reveal that card to all players. Shuffle your deck and put the revealed card on top of it.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.
cards.original_text: Phantom Warrior can't be intercepted.

cards.name: Prosperity
cards.text: Each player draws X cards.
cards.flavor: "Life can never be too good."
cards.original_text: Each player draws X cards.

rulings.text: If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Sorcerous Sight
cards.text:
Look at target opponent's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Do not react; anticipate.
cards.original_text: Look at your opponent's hand. You draw a card. (Draw the card from your deck.)

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending.  Storm crow departing, summer is starting.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Symbol of Unsummoning
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ."
—Kate Chopin, The Awakening
cards.original_text: Return any one creature to its owner's hand. You draw a card.

cards.name: Taunt
cards.text: During target player's next turn, creatures that player controls attack you if able.
cards.original_text: Choose any one player. On that player's next turn, all his or her creatures that can attack you must do so.

cards.name: Theft of Dreams
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Energy is never lost, only transformed.
cards.original_text: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.

cards.name: Thing from the Deep
cards.text: Whenever Thing from the Deep attacks, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an Island.
cards.flavor: Seafarers fear sailing off the world's edge not so much as down its gullet.
cards.original_text: If Thing from the Deep attacks, destroy one of your islands or destroy Thing from the Deep.

cards.name: Tidal Surge
cards.text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
cards.flavor:
"'Twas  when the seas were roaring
With hollow blasts of wind . . . ."
—John Gay, "The What D'Ye Call It"
cards.original_text: Tap any one, two, or three creatures without flying. (Tapped creatures can't intercept.)

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
cards.original_text: Return any one creature to the top of its owner's deck.

cards.name: Touch of Brilliance
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: Acting on one good idea is better than hoarding all the world's knowledge.
cards.original_text: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: "No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings." —William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Withering Gaze
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.
cards.original_text: Look at your opponent's hand. For each forest and green card there, you draw a card. (You draw from your deck.)

cards.name: Alluring Scent
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.flavor: Doom rarely smells this sweet.
cards.original_text: Choose any one creature. This turn, all creatures able to intercept that creature do so.

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.original_text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Anaconda can't be intercepted. Swamps are in play regardless of whether they're tapped or untapped.)

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: Something soft bumped against the rowboat, then was gone.
cards.original_text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Anaconda can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Bee Sting
cards.text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: There are few things as motivating as a swarm of bees.
cards.original_text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.
cards.original_text: Islandwalk (If defending player has any islands in play, Bull Hippo can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Charging Rhino
cards.text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: A rhino rarely uses its horn to announce its charge, only to end it.
cards.original_text: Charging Rhino can't be intercepted by more than one creature.

cards.name: Deep Wood
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.
cards.original_text:
Play Deep Wood only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, all damage dealt to you by attacking creatures is reduced to 0.

cards.name: Elite Cat Warrior
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.original_text: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Elite Cat Warrior can't be intercepted. Forests are in play regardless of whether they're tapped or untapped.)

cards.name: Elite Cat Warrior
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."
cards.original_text: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Elite Cat Warrior can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Elven Cache
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it themselves.
cards.original_text: Return any one card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Elvish Ranger
cards.flavor: It's up to you if you enter their woods—and up to them if you leave.

cards.name: Fruition
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each Forest on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Come to these woods and suffer no pain; you've burdens to lose and new life to gain.
cards.original_text: For each forest you and your opponent have in play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.
cards.original_text: Giant Spider can intercept as though it had flying.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Gorilla Warrior
cards.flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.original_text: Hurricane deals X damage to each player and each creature with flying. (This includes you and your creatures with flying.)

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.name: Jungle Lion
cards.text: Jungle Lion can't block.
cards.flavor: The lion's only loyalty is to its hunger.
cards.original_text: Jungle Lion can't intercept.

cards.name: Mobilize
cards.text: Untap all creatures you control.
cards.flavor: A rested mind is the sharpest weapon.
cards.original_text: Untap all your creatures.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.original_text: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn. (For example, a 6/3 creature would become 10/7.)

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Some cats are born fighters; others need a little persuading.
cards.original_text: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Moon Sprite
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Natural Order
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a green creature.
Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: Search your deck for a green summon creature and put that card into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand. Then put one of your green creatures into your discard pile. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

rulings.text: Sacrificing a green creature is part of Natural Order's cost. You can't sacrifice more creatures to search for more creature cards, and you can't cast Natural Order at all if you control no green creatures.

Players can respond to this spell only after it's been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to stop you from casting this spell or to make you sacrifice a different one.

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.
cards.flavor: Though many have come to this place to wash their wounds, the water has never turned red.
cards.original_text: You gain 8 life.

cards.name: Nature's Cloak
cards.text: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.original_text: All your green creatures gain forestwalk until the end of the turn. (If defending player has any forests in play, none of your green creatures can be intercepted.)

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.
cards.original_text: Search your deck for a forest and put that card into play. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.name: Needle Storm
cards.text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.original_text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying. (This includes your creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Plant Elemental
cards.text: When Plant Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice a Forest.
cards.original_text: When Plant Elemental comes into play from your hand, destroy one of your forests or destroy Plant Elemental.

cards.name: Primeval Force
cards.text: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.
cards.original_text: When Primeval Force comes into play from your hand, destroy three of your forests or destroy Primeval Force.

cards.name: Redwood Treefolk
cards.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

cards.name: Rowan Treefolk
cards.flavor: One of the forest's best protectors is the forest itself.

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor: It has more teeth than fit in its mouth.

cards.name: Stalking Tiger
cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: No one is happy when they notice a tiger.
cards.original_text: Stalking Tiger can't be intercepted by more than one creature.

cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.
cards.original_text: Take up to three lands from your hand and put them into play.

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.name: Sylvan Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.original_text: Search your deck for a summon creature and reveal that card to all players. Then shuffle your deck and put the revealed card on top of it.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Thundering Wurm
cards.text: When Thundering Wurm enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.
cards.original_text: When Thundering Wurm comes into play from your hand, discard a land from your hand or destroy Thundering Wurm.

cards.name: Treetop Defense
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Creatures you control gain reach until end of turn. (They can block creatures with flying.)
cards.original_text:
Play Treetop Defense only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, all your creatures can intercept as though they had flying.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: Search your deck for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest and put that card into play. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.name: Whiptail Wurm
cards.flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

cards.name: Willow Dryad
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Some think that dryads are the dreams of trees.
cards.original_text: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Willow Dryad can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Winter's Grasp
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Winter settles on the land, and the land prays it will wake.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one land.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: When Wood Elves comes into play from your hand, search your deck for a forest and put that card into play. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.original_text: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.original_text: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player. (For example, if you tap a mountain plus four other lands when you play Blaze, it deals 4 damage.)

cards.name: Boiling Seas
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavor: What burns the land, boils the seas.
cards.original_text: Destroy all islands. (This includes your islands.)

cards.name: Burning Cloak
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Burning Cloak deals 2 damage to that creature.
cards.original_text:
Any one creature gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
Burning Cloak deals 2 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Craven Giant
cards.text: Craven Giant can't block.
cards.flavor:
"The best armor is to keep out of range."
—Italian proverb
cards.original_text: Craven Giant can't intercept.

cards.name: Desert Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Never doubt a dragon just because of its size.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Devastation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
cards.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?
cards.original_text: Destroy all creatures and lands. (This includes your creatures and lands.)

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.original_text: Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without flying. (This includes you and your creatures without flying.)

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.name: Fire Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Fire Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Fire Dragon comes into play from your hand, it deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play.

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield, Fire Dragon will have to target itself. The ability is mandatory.

cards.name: Fire Imp
cards.text: When Fire Imp enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.original_text: When Fire Imp comes into play from your hand, it deals 2 damage to any one creature. (If you're the only player with creatures, Fire Imp deals 2 damage to one of your creatures.)

cards.name: Fire Snake
cards.text: When Fire Snake dies, destroy target land.
cards.flavor: The snake's final thrashings only spread the fire within it.
cards.original_text: If Fire Snake is put into your discard pile from play, destroy any one land.

cards.name: Fire Tempest
cards.text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.original_text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you. If all players drop to 0 life or less, the game is a draw.)

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.
cards.flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.
cards.original_text: Destroy all plains. (This includes your plains.)

cards.name: Forked Lightning
cards.text: Forked Lightning deals 4 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.
cards.original_text: Forked Lightning deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any one, two, or three creatures.

rulings.text: You divide the damage as you cast Forked Lightning, not as it resolves. Each target you choose must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.name: Goblin Bully
cards.flavor: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

cards.name: Highland Giant
cards.flavor: Though slow-witted and slow-moving, they are quick to anger.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot!

cards.name: Hulking Cyclops
cards.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
cards.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
cards.original_text: Hulking Cyclops can't intercept.

cards.name: Hulking Goblin
cards.text: Hulking Goblin can't block.
cards.flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.
cards.original_text: Hulking Goblin can't intercept.

cards.name: Last Chance
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.original_text: Take another turn after this one. You lose the game at the end of that turn. (You don't lose if you've already won.)

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Swing your axe as a broom, to sweep away the foe.
cards.original_text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to your opponent.

cards.name: Lava Flow
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land.
cards.flavor: People ran as never before at the thought of being buried and cremated at the same time.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one creature or land.

cards.name: Lizard Warrior
cards.flavor: Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.

cards.name: Minotaur Warrior
cards.flavor: The herd's patience, the stampede's fury.

cards.name: Mountain Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: Only the heroic and the mad follow mountain goat trails.
cards.original_text: Mountainwalk (If defending player has any mountains in play, Mountain Goat can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Pillaging Horde
cards.text: When Pillaging Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
cards.original_text: When Pillaging Horde comes into play from your hand, discard a card at random from your hand or destroy Pillaging Horde.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: Chaos does not choose its enemies.
cards.original_text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Raging Cougar
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor: Mountaineers quickly learn to travel with their spears always pointed up.
cards.original_text: Raging Cougar is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.original_text: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness. (It can attack the turn you play it, unless another card prevents this.)

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: Charging alone takes uncommon daring or uncommon stupidity. Or both.
cards.original_text: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Raging Minotaur
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.
cards.original_text: Raging Minotaur is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Rain of Salt
cards.text: Destroy two target lands.
cards.flavor:
It pelts the land with its fury,
spoiling what was once sweet.
cards.original_text: Destroy any two lands.

rulings.text: You must target two different lands. You can't choose to target just one.

cards.name: Scorching Spear
cards.text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.
cards.original_text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Scorching Winds
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Scorching Winds deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
cards.original_text:
Play Scorching Winds only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Scorching Winds deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.original_text: Spitting Earth deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountains.)

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
I cast a thousand tiny suns—
Beware my many dawns.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one land.

cards.name: Thundermare
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
cards.original_text:
Thundermare is unaffected by summoning sickness. 
When Thundermare comes into play from your hand, tap all other creatures. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.original_text:
Flying
Volcanic Dragon is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Cast the weight as though it were a die, to see a rival's fate.
cards.original_text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Wall of Granite
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: The wisest man builds his house behind the rock.
cards.original_text: Wall of Granite can't attack.

cards.name: Winds of Change
cards.text: Each player shuffles the cards from their hand into their library, then draws that many cards.
cards.original_text: Each player counts the cards in his or her hand, shuffles those cards into his or her deck, and then draws that many cards. (When you play Winds of Change, it doesn't count as a card in your hand.)

rulings.text: Each player draws a number of cards equal to the number of cards they shuffled into their own library.

cards.name: Alabaster Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Alabaster Dragon dies, shuffle it into its owner's library.
cards.original_text:
Flying
If Alabaster Dragon is put into your discard pile from play, shuffle Alabaster Dragon back into your deck.

rulings.text: This will always be shuffled into its owner's library.

cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: A peasant can do more by faith than a king by proclamation.
cards.original_text: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.original_text:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fights for hearth and home.
cards.original_text: Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Militia to tap.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.flavor:
"'O miserable of happy! Is this the end
Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, Paradise Lost
cards.original_text: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)

cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Blessed Reversal
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
cards.original_text:
Play Blessed Reversal only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
For each attacking creature, you gain 3 life.

rulings.text: The creatures are counted on resolution.

cards.name: Blinding Light
cards.text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
cards.flavor: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.
cards.original_text: Tap all creatures except for white creatures. (This includes your creatures.)

rulings.text: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

cards.name: Border Guard
cards.flavor: "Join the army, see foreign countries!" they'd said.

cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.original_text: Take any one summon creature from your discard pile and put that card into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand.

cards.name: Charging Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.
cards.original_text: If Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Defiant Stand
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Target creature gets +1/+3 until end of turn. Untap that creature.
cards.original_text:
Play Defiant Stand only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Any one creature gets +1/+3 until the end of the turn. If that creature is tapped, untap it.

cards.name: Devoted Hero
cards.flavor: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

cards.name: False Peace
cards.text: Target player skips all combat phases of their next turn.
cards.flavor: Mutual consent is not required for war.
cards.original_text: Choose any one player. That player can't attack on his or her next turn.

cards.name: Fleet-Footed Monk
cards.text: Fleet-Footed Monk can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor: "Hesitation is for the faithless. My belief lends me speed."
cards.original_text: Fleet-Footed Monk can't be intercepted by any creature with offense 2 or greater.

cards.name: Foot Soldiers
cards.flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

cards.name: Gift of Estates
cards.text: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three Plains cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: If your opponent has more lands in play than you do, search your deck for up to three plains and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

rulings.text: Gift of Estates does nothing if each of your opponents has the same number of lands or fewer as you.
You can find nonbasic lands if they have the Plains land type, such as dual lands (Tundra, et al).

cards.name: Harsh Justice
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.
cards.original_text:
Play Harsh Justice only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, each attacking creature that damages you also deals equal damage to the attacking player.

cards.name: Keen-Eyed Archers
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: "If it has wings, shoot it. If it doesn't, shoot it anyway."
cards.original_text: Keen-Eyed Archers can intercept as though it had flying.

cards.name: Knight Errant
cards.flavor:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

cards.name: Path of Peace
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
cards.flavor: The soldier reaped the profits of peace.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.

rulings.text: You are a creature's owner if the card representing it began the game in your deck, or if it's a token that entered the battlefield under your control. If Path of Peace targets a creature that you own but an opponent controls, you'll gain 4 life.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Path of Peace tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. No player gains life.

cards.name: Regal Unicorn
cards.flavor: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.

cards.name: Renewing Dawn
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each Mountain target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Dawn brings a new day, and a new day brings hope.
cards.original_text: For each mountain your opponent has in play, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Sacred Knight
cards.text: Sacred Knight can't be blocked by black and/or red creatures.
cards.flavor: "No flame, no horror can sway me from my cause."
cards.original_text: Sacred Knight can't be intercepted by black or red creatures.

cards.name: Sacred Nectar
cards.text: You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"
cards.original_text: You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Seasoned Marshal
cards.text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.original_text: If Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may choose to tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't intercept.)

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

cards.name: Spiritual Guardian
cards.text: When Spiritual Guardian enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: Hope is born within.
cards.original_text: When Spiritual Guardian comes into play from your hand, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Spotted Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Starlight
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Stars are like coins dropped into the night: their light buys safe passage.
cards.original_text: For each black creature your opponent has in play, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Starlit Angel
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: To soar as high as hope, to dive as swift as justice.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Steadfastness
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.
cards.original_text: All your creatures get +0/+3 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Stern Marshal
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Stern Marshal to give any one creature +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Temporary Truce
cards.text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
cards.original_text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two any player draws, that player gains 2 life. (You choose whether to draw first.)

cards.name: Valorous Charge
cards.text: White creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Stand in the way of truth at your peril.
cards.original_text: All white creatures get +2/+0 until the end of the turn. (This includes other players' white creatures.)

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: His presence brings not only a strong arm but also renewed hope.
cards.original_text: When Venerable Monk comes into play from your hand, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one tapped creature.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Wall of Swords can't attack.

cards.name: Warrior's Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.original_text: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn. (For example, a 1/2 creature would become 2/3.)

cards.name: Warrior's Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It is not the absence of fear that makes a warrior, but its domination.
cards.original_text: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods. They kill us for their sport."
—William Shakespeare, King Lear
cards.original_text: Put all creatures into their owners' discard piles. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Swamp
cards.original_text: B

cards.name: Swamp
cards.original_text: B

cards.name: Swamp
cards.original_text: B

cards.name: Swamp
cards.original_text: B

cards.name: Forest
cards.original_text: G

cards.name: Forest
cards.original_text: G

cards.name: Forest
cards.original_text: G

cards.name: Forest
cards.original_text: G

cards.name: Mountain
cards.original_text: R

cards.name: Mountain
cards.original_text: R

cards.name: Mountain
cards.original_text: R

cards.name: Mountain
cards.original_text: R

cards.name: Island
cards.original_text: U

cards.name: Island
cards.original_text: U

cards.name: Island
cards.original_text: U

cards.name: Island
cards.original_text: U

cards.name: Plains
cards.original_text: W

cards.name: Plains
cards.original_text: W

cards.name: Plains
cards.original_text: W

cards.name: Plains
cards.original_text: W

cards.name: Panther Warriors
cards.flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.
